programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different — until he picked up a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Marines combat correspondent Ken Plant tells of being captured and tortured as a POW.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Bow season is finally here and the boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma. Randy is chasing a buck he named "The Camp Buck" because of how close the buck is to camp. If Randy can get it done this will be his biggest buck to date in Oklahoma.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: First Shot

programme.title: Talhotblond

programme.title: The China Syndrome
programme.desc: A news reporter (Jane Fonda) and her cameraman (Michael Douglas) are unintentional witnesses to a SCRAM incident, an emergency core shutdown procedure at a nuclear power plant in California. The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: Lake Placid

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: When her plane crashes into a Chicago bridge, ace reporter Gale Gayley is saved by a mysterious and unlikely hero in this heart-warming comedy.

programme.title: Crazy in Alabama
programme.desc: Lucille, is an eccentric who goes to Hollywood to pursue her dreams. In tow is her nephew, Peejoe, an Alabama boy who's about to get a fast education.

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: A rich woman and a communist sailor are stranded on a deserted Mediterranean island where, after some fights, they unexpectedly fall for each other.

programme.title: Blonde Ambition
programme.desc: After small-town Katie follows her fiance to New York and catches him with another woman, she rebounds with a dream job that isn't what it appears.

programme.title: Private Valentine: Blonde & Dangerous
programme.desc: Megan Valentine was America's sweetheart. After the movie star suddenly becomes broke, she joins the Army, learning to live a life without luxury.

programme.title: Stealing Harvard

programme.title: S.I.S.

programme.title: My Mom's New Boyfriend

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.title: Loss of Innocence
programme.desc: Left alone because of their mother's sudden hospitalization during a vacation in France, four British children have to fend for themselves. They stay at a hotel, where, despite the reticence of owner Madame Zisi (Danielle Darrieux), they are befriended by her lover, Eliot (Kenneth More). Joss (Susannah York), the eldest of the children, runs afoul of Madame Zisi, who thinks Eliot is spending too much time with her and causes a scene. Robbed of Eliot's attention, Joss denounces him to the police.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: Port Afrique
programme.desc: An American (Phil Carey) returns to Morocco and discovers his wife's past while probing her death.

programme.title: Shockproof
programme.desc: Jenny Marsh (Patricia Knight) is a hard-luck dame who's just finished five years in the slammer for killing a man. Jenny's not exactly the murdering type -- she did the deed while defending her jailbird lover, Harry (John Baragrey), which is probably one reason she's attracted the attention of her parole officer, Griff Marat (Cornel Wilde). In fact, Griff is so taken with Jenny that he gets her a job caring for his ailing mother, but although Jenny tries to fly right, she's not yet over Harry.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: Boots Malone
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck jockey's agent takes a wealthy, yet neglected kid under his wing, and, with the help of others, turns him into a champion.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
programme.desc: Nick Romano (James Darren) lives in a poor tenement building on the south side of Chicago with his well-meaning but drug-addicted mother, Nellie (Shelley Winters). She encourages him to pursue his piano-playing talent in hopes that it will bring him a better life. Nellie's neighbors, like the alcoholic ex-lawyer (Burl Ives) who secretly loves her, help her in keeping Nick away from Louie, the resident drug dealer. But a chance meeting between Nick and Louie could change things forever.

programme.title: The Collector
programme.desc: A meek bank clerk and butterfly collector becomes increasingly obsessed with an art student who he’s determined to make fall in love with him.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Trail of the Rustlers
programme.desc: When a member of the villainous Mahoney family is slain while escaping the jail cell he'd been put in by Steve Armitage (Charles Starrett), aka the Durango Kid, the dead man's relatives vow to take down the Kid by any means necessary. Chick Mahoney (Don Harvey) poses as the Kid and tries to ruin the cowboy's reputation by stealing from nearby ranchers, but with the help of sidekick Smiley Burnette (Smiley Burnette), the Kid sets out to retrieve the stolen goods and repair his good name.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Return of Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The scout's grandson (Bill Elliott) foils land-grabbers; his sidekick (Dub Taylor) flirts with twins.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Fort Ti
programme.desc: Capt. Horn (George Montgomery) and Rogers' Rangers raid Fort Ticonderoga during the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Time After Time
programme.desc: When Jack the Ripper steals his time machine, H.G. Wells tracks him down.

programme.title: The Lusty Men
programme.desc: A faded rodeo star mentors a younger rider but falls for his wife.

programme.title: Tom Horn
programme.desc: Steve McQueen stars as a legendary American as untamed as the Old West.

programme.title: Lone Star
programme.desc: A frontiersman helps out with Texas's fight for independence from Mexico.

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: A nun cannot maintain her vow of peace when Nazis murder her father.

programme.title: The Office Wife
programme.desc: A gold-digging secretary sets out to lure her boss from his straying wife.

programme.title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond
programme.desc: In Prohibition-era New York, ferocious mobster Jack "Legs" Diamond rises through the underworld ranks, but learns he's no match for a deceitful woman.

programme.title: They Won't Believe Me
programme.desc: A faithless husband is charged with a murder he didn't commit.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A biography of a man who is unjustly convicted of murder, gets locked up in French Guiana, and devotes his life to escaping from prison.

programme.title: The Outfit
programme.desc: After unknowingly robbing a syndicate bank, an ex-con demands $250,000 from the mob to avenge his brother's death in a dangerous quest for justice.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette (1938)
programme.desc: Lavish biography of the French queen who "let them eat cake."

programme.title: Pocket Money
programme.desc: A small-town boy's school experiences the joys and pains of growing up.

programme.title: The Hypnotic Eye
programme.desc: A city is stricken by a wave of horrific self-mutilations.

programme.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
programme.desc: A man gets mixed up in palace intrigue when a king-to-be is kidnapped.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: The Music Man
programme.desc: After convincing Iowa townsfolk to invest in a boys' marching band, a traveling con man's scheme is complicated by his feelings for a local librarian.

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: On the eve of her wedding, a wealthy woman gets caught in a bind when her ex-husband and a handsome reporter make an appearance in her life.

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: A tennis star with an uncooperative wife and a wealthy man who wants to be rid of his father meet and make a deal on a Washington-to-New York train.

programme.title: North By Northwest
programme.desc: A lethal case of mistaken identity plunges a New York ad man into a race across the continent as he's pursued by foreign spies out to kill him.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Painful memories come flooding back when a gruesome copycat murder leads to the reopening of a case for Wade.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride's longtime friend, state and military attorney Rita Devereaux, asks NCIS to investigate the disappearance of a JAG lawyer who specializes in classified cases and volunteers at a private military academy.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A highly skilled special operations Marine assaults six men in a bar, sending the NCIS team on a city-wide manhunt.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates when a fire engulfs a popular night club, killing 16 people and injuring 58 others.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team delves into "tweaker" culture after a brutal murder is followed by a near-fatal explosion at the home of a methamphetamine addict.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio witnesses a dramatic prison break and later discovers one of the escapees is a child molester/murderer he put away six months earlier.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A playboy who enjoys diplomatic immunity becomes Horatio's prime suspect after a model is killed in a hit-and-run accident during Fashion Week.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio delves into the world of modern treasure-hunting after a victim is found skewered to his yacht with a harpoon.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team finds a rape victim clinging to life after being beaten, and Horatio suspects an imprisoned rapist is somehow responsible for the attack.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team responds after a gifted 14-year-old tennis player is kidnapped from her bedroom in the middle of the night.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A masked gunman opens fire at a bar, leaving its two owners dead and a third man wounded. Jay Mohr and John Heard guest star.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team investigates when three people are found dead after a hurricane strikes Miami; Calleigh finds a woman shot to death in a house that was recently looted.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A gas man is engulfed in invisible flames and dies during a qualifying race at the Grand Prix Americas.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio must find his brother's killer and protect a niece he never knew existed; the team explores voyeuristic Internet sites in connection with a stockbroker's murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A woman found eaten by a shark turns out to have been bait for a private investigator hired by wives to catch their unfaithful husbands.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates the murder of a thrill seeker who was abducted during the course of an extreme kind of role-playing game.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates the apparent suicide of an anesthesiologist and finds a link to a patient who died during routine plastic surgery.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A mentally impaired man is the only witness to the murder of a diamond broker gunned down in a parking garage; a body disappears on the way to the medical examiner's laboratory.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio suspects revenge is behind the murder of a man who tortured Cuban refugees.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A controlled fire in the Everglades reveals the body of a slain hunter, then a wall of fire overtakes Alexx and Delko at the crime scene, forcing them to take refuge under a tarpaulin.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio infers that a slain photographer accidentally witnessed a murder while snapping pictures of a famous actor.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A former surf champion is murdered in his home, while his wife and son are left beaten and bound.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Robbers steal $2.3 million from an armored truck in downtown Miami, but the loot turns out to be counterfeit, and the team must figure out what happened to the bank's money before it was replaced with fake bills.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Riley head overseas together to prevent a governmental collapse and inadvertently inhale new, deadly microscopic technology.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac, Desi and Russ go under cover during a royal Indian wedding to protect a princess whose policies could put her life in danger; Bozer suspects Riley is up to her old hacking ways.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team delve into the world of Italian car culture to track down a crime boss; Mac must lean on Desi when he discovers that he's losing the ability to control his hands; Mac and Desi move in together.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Desi travel with Bozer to his childhood home when his aunt dies in a tragic accident; they soon discover she may have been murdered for trying to expose the city's contaminated water supply.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Riley go missing and wake up 24 hours later in a cornfield with no memory of how they got there; they must unravel the mystery and find out how to get rid of the nanotrackers in their bodies, no matter the cost.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Special agents for the Department of External Services, Angus "Mac" MacGyver and Jack Dalton, work to recover a missing bioweapon.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver and the team attempt to rescue Jack's former CIA partner who went missing in Venezuela after finding evidence to take down an international arms dealer.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: In Malaysia, MacGyver and the team extract a terrorist group's money man who has intel on an impending attack, but when the man is shot, MacGyver must keep him alive in order to learn the terrorists' plans.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When prostitutes are murdered in Texas, their deaths seem to have religious overtones; members of the team are put at risk throughout the course of the investigation.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The investigation in Texas reveals a deep web of corruption; Garcia must save a friend.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates a series of murders with unidentifiable victims in Bakersfield, Calif.; agent Kate Callahan joins the team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team members search for a vengeful suspect who was once abused; Garcia travels to Texas to confront the person she shot.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team goes to Colorado to investigate when a passenger jet crashes; the incident reminds Kate of a family tragedy.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A body is found covered in scratches, leading the BAU to believe that the person responsible has a chronic skin disorder.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A child reappears one year after he went missing -- but the team must work quickly when a trick-or-treater disappears under similar circumstances.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team has a difficult time finding a common denominator among several male victims in Montana; J.J. struggles with feelings about her sister's death.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team believes a suspect is taking on the persona of an Internet urban legend when people with substantial social media followings are found dead; Savannah and Morgan try to find time for each other.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott investigate the shotgun murder of Jamie Cruikshank, a barman at the Maid in Splendour, a pub in the village of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: The search for a missing birdwatcher reveals an international smuggling ring.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: Max and Miranda head to the hills on horseback to investigate a murder.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Wallander is in Capetown to attend a conference when a voluntary worker goes missing.

programme.title: Wallander

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The wheels are spinning as the world-famous Barrett-Jackson collector car auction descends on Houston, Texas, with bidders duking it out for a chance to take home some of the greatest cars ever seen at jaw-dropping prices.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mike Joy looks through the differences between a resto mod and a custom.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bidders compete to hit the jackpot by winning a vintage HEMI 'Cuda and other rare collector rides.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A collector car is anything that is desirable; new and old crossing the block, from '22 Broncos and Jeep Wranglers to classic Blazers and Ramchargers.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bigger is better in Texas, and the Barrett-Jackson Live auctions in Houston prove it with cars like the 1957 Pontiac Bonneville and the Toyota GR Supra Launch Edition crossing the block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: They say everything is bigger in Texas; car and truck fanatics battle it out on the Barrett-Jackson bidding floor to see who drives away with the biggest wins.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson is thrilled to be back in Scottsdale, Ariz., to celebrate its golden anniversary; 50 Years of camaraderie, commotion and cars and Barrett-Jackson shows no sign of slowing down.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the world's greatest cars cross the auction block at Barrett Jackson's 50th anniversary ceremony in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Take a look at the men who undertake one of the most dangerous jobs on earth--ice road truckers.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Jay hauls a 17-ton water tank over 31 inches of ice all the way to the De Beers Diamond mine.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: An arctic storm forces a road closure. Alex hauls a 44,000 pound diamond ore crusher across 350-miles of ice to the BHP mine.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the 18th day of the ice road season and truckers have delivered more than 3000 loads to the diamond mines. The temperatures are dropping, the loads are getting heavier.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's half way through the grueling ice road season. Six hundred truckers have ferried more than 4,000 loads to the northern mines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Truckers have hauled more than 100,000 tons of supplies in temperatures of forty degrees below zero, but accidents and strict safety regulations have sent many drivers packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's just over a month into the new ice road season and more than 800 truckers are on the ice, working around the clock.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 37 of the ice road season and there almost 3,000 more loads to go. Drivers are washing out and the road is beaten up.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 53 of the ice road season and only the toughest truckers remain on a road that's sent many people packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Just five days into the Arctic adventure, Mother Nature is about to strike and wreak havoc on the ice roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After the storm clears, most of the truckers are ready to roll--all except Rick, who is on the verge of quitting and looks to Hugh for advice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has dropped Duane Lee from the team, and Leland is feeling caught in the middle. When Leland confronts Dog and Beth about the decision tempers flare.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Cecily has graduated from High School and Dog believes the time is right to show her what the family business is all about. The rough and tumble world of bounty hunting is very different than the all girls private school.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is out to make two grabs on two islands in one day. Part of the team is dispatched to Kona to nab a woman who skipped her court date. Meanwhile, Dog and the others hunt Patrick, a fugitive who's fighting in an Extreme Boxing event on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's feeling lucky, so he's going to try to capture two women in one day. The first, Moani, has "crazy" tattooed on her neck and is facing drug charges. Dog and the team will have to chase her down at the beach if they're going to bring her in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog usually takes his job personally, but this time a case really hits home. First, he and Beth receive a special gift--a painting of Dog's recently deceased daughter, Barbara Katy.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Colorado helping a fellow bondsmen clean up his files. The target today has a history of violence, and apparently plans to re-locate without notifying the proper authorities.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog thinks he's got an average day of bounty hunting ahead of him, but he couldn't be more wrong. Beth calls a client, Daphne, whose bond they have to revoke and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call--The Dog! And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy. He enlists the family in an elaborate hoax to lure the runner home.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has dropped Duane Lee from the team, and Leland is feeling caught in the middle. When Leland confronts Dog and Beth about the decision tempers flare.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Cecily has graduated from High School and Dog believes the time is right to show her what the family business is all about. The rough and tumble world of bounty hunting is very different than the all girls private school.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Justin is the low man on the totem pole in the Chapman clan, and this means that the rest of the team is always teasing him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in for a big surprise after he catches a fugitive named Jonaven in a sting operation. In a teary heart-to-heart talk, Dog finds out that Jonaven's father was killed in a shoot-out with police when Jonaven was only 9. Dog then

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today, Dog and the boys are going after a fugitive with a serious price tag. Tim failed to appear in court on a $25,000 bond and has a string of theft charges behind him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have to be at the state capitol bright and early to receive an award for their fight against ice in Hawaii. Afterwards, they're inspired to start the hunt for Shanna, an alleged ice user and identity thief with $80,000 in bonds.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A one-hour special that looks back at 2006, one of Dog's most tumultuous years, which has included the passing of Beth's father, Dog and Beth's wedding, the tragic death of Dog's daughter Barbara, and the sudden arrest of Dog, Tim, and Leland.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Beth's birthday and Dog knows just what she needs, whether she knows it or not! He surprises Beth with Delilah, a Papillion puppy small enough to sit in the palm of her hand.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's fugitive is accused of assaulting a police officer, so Dog and the team are not taking any chances. While on the Big Island and Dog convinces the felon's friends and family to join forces and then learns he has fled to another island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog faces a tough personal and professional situation when he must hunt down his friend, Ili, who has helped him on many busts. But now Ili's on the other side of the law. She's didn't come to court to answer charges that

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The co-signer on this bond is seven months pregnant, and she says that the man she bailed out has threatened her safety and has been running amok on the streets. Now Dog and the posse have got to revoke John's bail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog is back in Hawaii confronted with two alleged felons who are in crisis. Family and friends of these bondees are convinced that they are getting into further trouble while awaiting trial.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks but that's not the case with "Dog" Chapman. To his traditional bounty hunting tools of confidential informants, canvassing, and silver-tongued subterfuge the world's greatest bounty hunter has added Facebook!

programme.title: JonBenét's Mother: Victim or Killer?
programme.desc: An in-depth reconstruction of the life of Patsy Ramsey—socialite, beauty queen, wife, mother, and suspected killer of JonBenet, her daughter.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Atlanta, a stranger guns down a new father in a parking lot; in Georgia's Gwinnett County, a man is stabbed more than 20 times when someone he trusts turns against him.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Mobile, Ala., a street fight escalates to a shooting that leaves a man dead in his front yard; in Tulsa, Okla., a drive-by shooting stemming from a gang feud claims the life of a 16-year-old girl, while her boyfriend clings to life.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: When a young man goes missing in Tulsa, Okla., detectives must crack a family's code of silence in order to find him.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A rookie detective struggles to unravel the mystery of a teenager found naked and shot to death in an Atlanta park; the case captures the hearts of the public and, with tips flooding in, the detectives work round the clock to find her killer/killers.

programme.title: The First 48: My First Homicide
programme.desc: When an innocent bystander protecting a young woman is gunned down, detectives scramble to learn who fired the fatal shots before anyone else gets hurt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's hunt takes Dog far from the glittering hotels of Waikiki to the parts of Hawaii tourist rarely see, Oahu's ramshackle tent cities. The team searches for a woman who has lost almost everything, her home, her family and her spirit.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy. He enlists the family in an elaborate hoax to lure the runner home.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: An accused car thief jumps off a 36-foot bridge to avoid capture; an armed fugitive on the run breaks into a building full of law school students; a DUI suspect flees by car, foot, and water before deputies capture him.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Police on the ground and in the air pursue suspects as they commit multiple carjackings; officers chase a murder suspect through a crowded big box store; police pursue a convicted felon at speeds over 110 miles an hour.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Law enforcement officers pursue fugitives on the run; deputies race to extract a mother and her daughters from their truck after a fleeing suspect crashes into them; fish and wildlife officers pursue a fugitive attempting to escape by swimming away.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: A desperate couple hold a truck driver hostage in his own semi; marine patrol deputies chase down smugglers in a high-speed boat chase; officers report a late-night pursuit of a suspect fleeing in reverse.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: A man wanted for robbery and carjacking leads sheriff's deputies on a chase through crowded city streets; police get in a foot chase with an attempted murder suspect; a late-night, 145-mile-an-hour highway pursuit; and more.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Andy Bustamante and Investigative Journalist Paul Beban return to the ranch that Robert Bigelow owned at the same time as Skinwalker.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: By the late 1940s, UFO sightings and reports of downed flying saucers are so rampant, the U.S. government forms a top-secret group to investigate; reports of an alleged alien abduction stoke nationwide fear.

programme.title: UFO's: Top Secret Alien Files
programme.desc: For everyday heroes in law enforcement and the military, their mission to serve and protect is put to the ultimate test when they come face to face with dangerous UFOs; dramatic re-enactments of actual UFO classified files and expert interviews.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Black and white photos taken in 1951 suggest that a woman in St. Petersburg, Florida spontaneously combusts; a brain-numbing noise plaguing Brooklyn residents; a woman claims to have witnessed something even scarier than a Chinese Spy Balloon.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A silver orb in the sky, and alleged crash debris may be from a UFO; a 65-year-old-man might have some of the fastest hands in the West; an infamous spy organization's alleged footage of UFOs and aliens.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
